judged_meaning: the difference in electrical charge between two points in a circuit expressed in volts
precontext: The old machine hummed in the corner of the workshop. Clara examined its dusty dials with a furrowed brow. She wondered if it could be brought back to life.
ending: She collected a battery reader and looked on earnestly, willing some life back into the old machine.
example_sentence: The circuit has a high potential difference.

judged_meaning: installation from which a military force initiates operations
precontext: The troops were stationed at a remote camp for training. To pass the time, they often engaged in recreational sports. One afternoon, they decided to play a game on the field next to their tents.
sentence: The soldiers were playing a bat and ball game, which involved them running towards the base.
ending: Unfortunately, the sentries saw them approaching and shot them all dead.
example_sentence: The troops strategized at their forward base.
